list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: use or expend carelessly, extravagantly, or to no purpose.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: we can't afford to waste electricity
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Chúng ta không thể đủ khả năng để lãng phí điện

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: (of a person or a part of the body) become progressively weaker and more emaciated.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: cô ấy đã lãng phí rõ ràng

list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: he seized their cattle and wasted their country
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: anh ta nắm lấy gia súc của họ và lãng phí đất nước của họ

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: (of a material, substance, or byproduct) eliminated or discarded as no longer useful or required after the completion of a process.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: ensure that waste materials are disposed of responsibly
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: đảm bảo rằng vật liệu thải được xử lý có trách nhiệm

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: (of an area of land, typically in a city or town) not used, cultivated, or built on.
an act or instance of using or expending something carelessly, extravagantly, or to no purpose.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: it's a waste of time trying to argue with him
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Thật lãng phí thời gian cố gắng tranh luận với anh ta

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: material that is not wanted; the unusable remains or byproducts of something.
a large area of barren, typically uninhabited land.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the icy wastes of the Antarctic
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: chất thải băng giá của Nam Cực

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: damage to an estate caused by an act or by neglect, especially by a life-tenant.
